speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Yeah, dudes! Welcome to your Dumb Ass Show! I am Sky Commander Winky and this is the beautiful Captain Dare!

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE
line: Yeah, baby! Woo-hoo!

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: The biggest Dumb Ass I know.

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE
line: Thank you, Sky Commander.

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Yes, Captain Dare will show you what a dumb ass he really is. But be forewarned, only a stupid dumb ass would neglect to take every safety precaution in the stunts you're about to witness. C'mon!

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Now, the physics alone took almost five minutes of calculations. Oh, oh... yes!

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE
line: Yeah, dude, fire when ready.

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE
line: Aah, mother! What the !

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Now that's a dumb ass! Oh, right in the target!

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE
line: Hey, Natalie, come here. How about a kiss for good luck?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Bill, why are you doing this?

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: His name's Captain Dare and he'll be famous one day for going where no dudes have gone before.

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE
line: Hey, if you won't give me a kiss how about throwing me a magazine?

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Yeah! Yeah! Oh, yeah!

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Hey, hey... that... that is it! Whoo! There it is!

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: There it is, yes! That is a dumb ass! That is a dumb ass!

speaker: SCENE #3
line: "CART OF DOOM"

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: ... and now, the awesome Captain Dare will make dumb ass history in the scientifically-modified shopping cart of doom --- rolling down this hill hitting the launch ramp at an estimated 24.6 miles an hour sailing just over the scrumptious Natalie Gordon who will be holding this flaming torch in her mouth.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Whoa, I didn't say I was going to do anything.

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: What? I is the money shot, Natalie. We need you. Captain, will you tell her?

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE (BILL)
line: Yeah, come on, Natalie... what could go wrong?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: What could go wrong?! You mean besides landing on me and crushing my head, Bill? Would you...? her torch will set the cart on fire-- whoosh-- and our daring hero rolling on to salvation into the pool of life. Triumphant.

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE (BILL)
line: Natalie, come on, just do it for me, please? Please? Please?

speaker: THE CROWD
line: Yeah, come on, Natalie.

speaker: CAPTAIN DARE (BILL)
line: Come on.

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Captain Dumb Ass !

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Now that's a dumb ass.

speaker: SKY COMMANDER WINKY
line: Come on, Bill, get up! Hey, Bill!

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Thanks for coming so quickly.

speaker: REYES
line: Are you the medical examiner?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Yes, yes, I'm Dr. Fountain. And you're the experts from the FBI?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The experts?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Well, I was told you were the experts.

speaker: REYES
line: We work on the X-Files. Our expertise is the unexplained.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We were told you had an unexplained death here.

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Well, you're the experts you tell me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So why don't you explain exactly what happened here, doctor?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Well, I can't. That's the point.

speaker: REYES
line: You can't tell us anything?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Well, all things considered, I'd prefer not to go on record.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Why is that?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Well, it's the kid's parents. They're suing everyone.

speaker: REYES
line: For what?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Everything. They're suing the county for making the street too steep, the supermarket he stole the shopping cart from, the company that made the helmet he was wearing.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Off the record, Doc... what the hell has that got to do with a supermarket shopping cart?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: You familiar with The Dumb Ass Show?

speaker: REYES
line: The Dumb Ass Show?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: It's a cable TV show where the kids act like, well, dumb asses. They videotape themselves doing stupid stunts.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You mean this was an accident?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: I'd prefer not to get sucked into a legal nightmare here. You investigate the unexplained. How about you explain it to me?

speaker: REYES
line: Dr. Fountain, do you see this?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell is that?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: You're asking me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thanks for coming so quickly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The message said urgent. What is it you want me to look at here?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We were hoping you could tell us.

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Is, uh, she the expert?

speaker: DR. FOUNTAIN
line: Well? What do you think?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I have to say that, uh... I've never seen anything quite like this before.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, something killed this kid.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, judging from the amount of insect faeces in the ear and nasal cavities it appears that they fed at such a furious rate that it caused the boy's skull to collapse from the inside. His helmet protected his head during the there is no impact trauma here whatsoever. None.

speaker: REYES
line: You're saying flies killed him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All the kids at the scene... and the flies choose to attack this boy? Why?

speaker: REYES
line: Maybe they were attracted for reasons we're not seeing.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What if somebody put something in his helmet? Insect pheromone. You know, "Spanish Fly"--that stuff you see advertised in the back of magazines that guys use to attract girls. I glance at them for amusement.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I may have to brush up on my "Spanish Fly" but I don't think the science works that way. Anyway, before we start looking for M.O., I want to find out what kind of fly would act that aggressively.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: The musca vetustissima walker. The Australian Bush Fly. It craves protein so much it will actually crawl into your open nose, mouth, ears even your eyes to feed on nutritious blood and moisture. Though the New Zealand screw-worm fly often kills its victims in mere moments by burrowing into an open wound or cut.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: I'm sorry. I'm Dr. Rocky Bronzino. Hi. Rocky Bronzino. Hello there. Rocky Bronzino, field entomological expert at Rutgers University, at your service.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Bronzino...

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Rocky.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These flies you mentioned neither of them are indigenous to North America. Are you suggesting that we've got a virulent foreign vector here?

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: No. The specimens you collected are your garden-variety calliphorid. Harmless as, well... flies.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What are you suggesting then?

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Nothing. Dr. Fountain brought me in for my scientific expertise. And I must say... I'm glad he did.

speaker: REYES
line: Dr. Bronzino, you should know we may be looking at a murder.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: A murder? Are there any suspects?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Leave me alone, Winky.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: It's for The Dumb Ass Memorial Video. For our fallen hero. Just a few words for Captain Dare, come on. And so is your brother for making Bill do all those stupid stunts.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: Hey, Captain Dare died doing what he loved! Pushing the envelope. Maybe if you weren't such a...

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: Hey, you! Freaky-deaky. You want your own memorial, huh? You want to be in Dumb Ass?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Just leave her alone.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: I'm talking to you now, freak.

speaker: PRINCIPAL LOKENSGARD
line: David Winkle. In my office, right now! up for him. Baby.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I think I just solved this case. This kid had crap for brains and the flies couldn't resist.

speaker: REYES
line: Oh, and you were such a choirboy growing up?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I mean, we did some stupid stuff but we didn't know it was stupid at the time. This isn't just stupid, this is glorification of stupid. These kids take enormous pride in being sub-mental.

speaker: PRINCIPAL LOKENSGARD
line: Mr. David Winkle.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sky Pilot Winky. Just the man we want to see. Come on in. estimated 24.6 miles an hour sailing over the scrumptious Natalie Gordon... ] Pilot.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: Sky Commander, if you don't mind.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And you can call me Sheriff John when I haul your dumb ass off to jail, Winky.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: REYES
line: We obtained a copy of a recent e-mail you sent offering to sell the video of your friend's death to the fox network.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: What? No, no, no, I wrote all the networks. Fox was the only one who had any interest in it.

speaker: REYES
line: I don't think you understand.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: Wait... you think I killed him? You think I killed Captain Dare to make money? My best friend?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, looking at this video you were the last person to have contact with him. You handed him his helmet at the top of the hill. I think you put something in it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sit down, Sky Commander...

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: I can't! I'm being attacked! Oh, god, it's happening to me!

line: Where you been? Dinner's been on the table almost an hour, young man.

line: I'm not hungry.

line: Well, then, you sit down here until you get hungry, Dylan. I have something to talk to you about. Dylan!

line: It's no trying to place your hand where I can't see because I understand that you're different from me ]

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Dylan?

line: Dylan?

speaker: [PINK FLOYD MUSIC
line: Yes, I can tell that you can't be... ]

speaker: [PINK FLOYD MUSIC
line: ...What you pretend ]

speaker: [PINK FLOYD MUSIC
line: ... and you're rocking backwards and you're rocking towards .. ]

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm glad you're here. I think we just got our first real break.

speaker: REYES
line: What did you find?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's what the entomologist Rocky Bronzino found. The flies that ate at the brain and skull of the victim are all female. Every last one of them.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Exactly how is that a break?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what are the chances of that?

speaker: REYES
line: You mean that the absence of males suggests there's a reason for the attack. Behaviourally.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, something biological is going on. Whether it's hormonal or chemical something has caused these bugs to attack.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Or a need to express themselves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: To what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is a kid that calls himself "Sky Commander Winky." Agent Reyes and I were interviewing him as a suspect when this happened.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The paramedics arrived and treated him for an aggressive attack of body lice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmm. Lice are not altogether uncommon in a school environment.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Except that these are better spellers than most of the kids.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what are you saying? That this is just another dumb ass stunt?

speaker: REYES
line: Well, that was my first thought. But the victim here was just too freaked out by this incident to make me believe he'd staged this. Which leads me to think that while you may be right about this being a matter of biology, someone is directing the biology.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How does one direct bugs?

speaker: REYES
line: I don't know how but we've been running down a long list of witnesses.

speaker: REYES
line: A loner who was present at every dumb ass stunt and who had a run-in with this kid Winky at school just prior to the lice attacking. His name is Dylan Lokensgard. We're going to want to talk to him.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: It's just not a good time right now. He's unable to talk.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Dylan? Dylan, I want to have a talk with you.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Honey, can you come out here?

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Dylan? Dylan? Dylan!

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: where are you going?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: To school.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: I know where you're going.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Well, what did Natalie want?

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: You stay away from her. Dylan, she's no good for you. She's only going to get you into trouble.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Natalie and I are friends. We've been friends since we were kids.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: But you're not kids anymore, Dylan. Which is why we need to talk, honey.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: You're going through changes. Your body is going through changes.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: You don't understand anything. I don't want to talk to you. I wish dad was still here. You don't know anything about me.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Honey, I want what's best for you. Dylan! Come back Dylan!

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: So many flowers... so little time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me?

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Pheromones, Dr. Scully. Heavy in the air. Nature's natural attractants. Driving the insect world to go forth and pollinate.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm aware of how pheromones work. But according to this device there isn't a single pheromone to be found out here.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Well, that can't be right. The bio-sensor we uses an actual fly antennae over which the pheromones pass. But I modified the EAG to measure in picograms which makes it sensitive to traces a mile in any direction. But I'm still not sure why you think that pheromones might cause an otherwise harmless fly to attack a human so violently, Doctor...

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Rocky.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rocky.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Bugs are small-minded creatures, and therefore very predictable. They don't have moods, E. They react to circumstance and stimuli as they have been doing for millennia.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what do you suppose they're reacting to out here?

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: It may be the bugs are being somehow driven crazy with desire. You know, they say we humans respond to pheromones, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I tend to agree with that, yeah.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: "Women's dormitory syndrome." It's believed that pheromones are the reason that women who live together share the same menstrual cycle.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Fascinating.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: You know, when a male and female calliphorid fly mate they stay joined for up to one and a half hours. One and a half, doctor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, Rocky... I'm a mother.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Mothers are women, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: A high concentration of c-13 calliphorone... Incoming.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Natalie!

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Dylan?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Are you all right?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: I'm fine.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: What about your bike?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Um, I'll get it later.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I came by your house to see you.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Oh, really?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Yeah, your mom made it sound like there was something wrong with you.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Me? I'm fine. What-what did you want?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I wanted to apologize about what happened yesterday in the cafeteria. Winky can be such a jerk. I was just worried about you.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: W-w-what'd I say?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Nothing. No one understands. My mom and dad think it's just going to go away. What I'm feeling...

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: You-you mean about Bill?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I wish I could just turn back time. I wish we could just... make everything go away and start all over again.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: I know. Like-like when we were kids.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Yeah. Remember the night we played hide-and-seek on your street?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Manhunt.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: We hid in the tree together.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Our names are still carved in it.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I'm-I'm going to get marked late.

speaker: REYES
line: Dylan Lokensgard? Can you come with us, Dylan?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: why are you showing me this?

speaker: REYES
line: What do you think of it?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: You mean, the dumb ass show?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That, and the kids who make it.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: I know them, you know...

speaker: REYES
line: you ever have contact with bill? The kid who played captain dare?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: No.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You have anything against him?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: No.

speaker: REYES
line: Do you think it's strange that he was attacked and killed by insects?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Who wouldn't?

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: What's going on in here?

speaker: REYES
line: We're talking to Dylan.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Oh, no, you're not. Dylan...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ma'am...

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: No one interrogates my son in my office without my permission.

speaker: REYES
line: Just calm down, Mrs. Lokensgard.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: He's not a part of that crowd. What are you accusing him of?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We're not accusing him. Just trying to see what he knows.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: He doesn't know anything.

speaker: REYES
line: He was at the crime scene.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Yeah, well, so were a lot of kids. Dylan...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're too late, gentlemen. Bugs are gone. Bugs are all gone. Whatever.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How's he doing?

speaker: REYES
line: He's unhurt, apparently. Not so much as a single bite on him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mrs. Lokensgard? I don't think we've finished talking to Dylan.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Oh, yes, you have! We're going home.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I've said it before and I'll say it again: The whole reason this case is attracting flies is because somebody's full of crap.

speaker: REYES
line: I think what we just saw was a show. Dylan Lokensgard caused those bugs to attack him to make himself look like a victim instead of the perpetrator.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Okay, but how? This guy's a horse whisperer, only for bugs?

speaker: REYES
line: I don't know how he's doing it but I may know a way to find out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where did you get this?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dylan Lokensgard provided it to us when we interviewed him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to warn you, there's typically not a lot to be found in a teenage boy's sweaty kleenex.

speaker: REYES
line: We were looking for pheromones. Aren't there pheromones produced in adolescent sweat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, it's what causes B.O., But all too obviously it's not all that attractive--to anything.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: I've got a reading here that's going right off the scale. Holy Toledo! We've got pheromones coming out the ying-yang here. C-13 calliphorene and how.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What happened?

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: I think my electroantennogram just... tilted.

speaker: REYES
line: What's c-13 calliphorone?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Insect pheromone.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Where did you find this mother lode?

speaker: REYES
line: A boy named Dylan Lokensgard. That specimen came from him.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: A boy... is secreting bug pheromones? That's impossible. Preposterous.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're the expert Dr. Bronzino. How else do you explain it, then?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rocky?

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: A boy is a boy, a bug is a bug. You can't have it both ways.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, so this boy's going through puberty, right? I mean, maybe his body chemistry is somehow just going crazy and it's his raging teenage hormones that are attracting all these insects.

speaker: REYES
line: What if it's more than chemistry and hormones? More than biology?

speaker: REYES
line: Dylan's not just attracting these bugs he's using them to act out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, but against what?

speaker: REYES
line: We saw him talking to a girl.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The one in the dumb ass video. Captain dare's girlfriend.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Natalie... ?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Dylan?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: What are you doing?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I need to talk to you, Dylan.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: You have to be quiet--It's my mom, she's going to hear you.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I'm coming up.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: What? No.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Hey... you're going to break your neck.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Shh.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I haven't been here in so long.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Since 4th grade. After school. And it was a Wednesday in April. "A dream in a mist of gray." That's from a Syd Barrett song.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: How do you know all these things?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: My dad told me. Syd Barrett, he was in the band Pink Floyd. He was, like this brilliant guy that nobody understood.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Kind of like you?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Me?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I never said I was sorry when your dad disappeared, Dylan. I never said a lot of things. But I want to say them now. I know you've always cared about me. We've grown apart, but... I haven't forgotten you. And... after we talked this morning at school I realized... how special you really are to me.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: I can't believe this.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: After what happened to Bill... I realized how important it is to have someone who does understand you and... I wanted to do this.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: That... that was amazing.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: What... what... was that?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: What was what?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Your... your... your mouth, your tongue... there's something wrong with you.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: No, don't-don't say that.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: I got to go.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Natalie, please. Please, don't. Just stay.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Natalie, listen to me! Natalie, please...

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: Hey, bug boy! How about we go for a little buzz around the block.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: So, Lokensgard... how'd you do it, huh? How'd you kill him?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: I thought bugs killed Captain Dare.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: Yeah, bugs who do what you say.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: You want to know how I did it? I'll show you. But maybe you should get your camera ready.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: I just have to open my mouth. Look!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Lokensgard? Dylan?

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: I'm getting a reading here. Trace levels inside the house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I guess that's probable cause.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Dr. Scully? This is so exciting. I've never had a partner before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: I'd like to think of it as a hymenopteran relationship. Two scientists using their special knowledge reaching higher than either of them could ever reach alone. And if I may say so, Doctor, you complete me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got upstairs, you take down.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: All right.

line: hey!

line: Who's that?

line: Someone's coming.

speaker: BOY
line: Ow!

speaker: BOY
line: Get us out!

speaker: BOY
line: oh, god. Ow! God!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: David Winkle, is that you?

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: Yeah.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Now that's a dumb ass.

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: It wasn't a stunt, it was, uh... it was Dylan Lokensgard. He attacked us.

speaker: REYES
line: He attacked you?

speaker: DAVID WINKLE
line: Yeah, the dude's a freakin' bug. He chewed right out the back window. Ow! girl's house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm with ROCKY at the Lokensgard's house. But there's nobody here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, well, I'm afraid the kid's on a tear. He's caused a car accident out here on Glenhaven road.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How'd he do that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You'd better see for yourself.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: C-13 calliphorone. I'm getting a stiff new reading from up here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, Dylan's bedroom's up there. Unfortunately, he's not in it.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Where are you going?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The kid's on a rampage.

speaker: ROCKY BRONZINO
line: Whoa!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got my number, partner.

speaker: REYES
line: Natalie?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Whoever you are, leave me alone.

speaker: REYES
line: Natalie, I'm Monica Reyes, with the FBI. I'm here because I need your help. It's about Dylan Lokensgard.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Don't say that name around me!

speaker: REYES
line: It's important. You may be the key to this, to stopping him.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: Dylan Lokensgard is a freak! I thought he was the normal one.

speaker: REYES
line: Dylan was normal, just like any other kid. Whatever it is he's going through it has to do with what he's beco...

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: He kissed me!

speaker: REYES
line: And it's probably what he's living for. And now it's probably why he lost all control and attacked David Winkle and his brother.

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: He attacked Winky?

speaker: REYES
line: They're going to be okay. We just want to make sure he doesn't hurt anyone else, Natalie. All right?

speaker: REYES
line: Come with me.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Why did you run from me?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: What is wrong with you?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: I'm different, Natalie... isn't that what you wanted? Somebody different from Bill and Winky?

speaker: NATALIE GORDON
line: You killed Bill.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: To keep you from being killed. And now you're coming with me.

speaker: REYES
line: Just stay where you are, Dylan.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: Don't try to stop me. That little talk that you wanted to have with me? It'll have to wait.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: Where do you think you're going?

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: It's where we're going, me and Natalie. I'll be taking the car.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: You'll be doing nothing of the sort.

speaker: DYLAN LOKENSGARD
line: You don't want to cross me, mom. I am not some kid everybody can kick around anymore.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: You think I don't know what you are? It's what I've been trying to tell you, Dylan to save you from what you are about to do. These are the things I couldn't tell you. The things I couldn't tell your father.

speaker: MRS. ANNE T. LOKENSGARD
line: You are not like the other kids. You never will be.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica! Monica! Holy mother... Monica, hold on! Can you hear me? Monica, can you breathe? Monica, talk to me.

speaker: REYES
line: He's got the girl.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where'd they go?

speaker: REYES
line: To Dylan's house.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's where Scully is. She lost phone contact with the entomologist, Bronzino.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are they?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Natalie!

speaker: BRONZINO
line: Help me.

speaker: SCULLY (VOICE OVER)
line: Four more bodies were found in the Lokensgard attic including that of Michael Lokensgard, Dylan's father, long reported missing.

speaker: SCULLY (VOICE OVER)
line: It now appears that he, like the others, fell victim to Dylan's mother who, in Dr. Rocky Bronzino's expert opinion, was neither human nor insect but something in between. A biological anomaly, whose differences from the rest of humanity could be hidden only for so long.

speaker: SCULLY (VOICE OVER)
line: However strong Dylan Lokensgard's yearning to fit in, to win acceptance, to love and to be loved he could not defeat the unseen forces which direct behaviour.

speaker: SCULLY (VOICE OVER)
line: In the struggle between our desire to determine who and what we will be and the identity which biology defines for us there can only be one outcome. But even in victory, there are forces biology can not defeat -- the stirring of the soul the mysteries of desire the simple truth that the heart wants... what the heart wants.
